headerText: Design and branding for a conceptual non-profit focused on fighting hunger.

caseStudy.content: Appearing serious enough for donors, while still engaging younger audiences was a common pain point I saw in Nonprofits. For Hunger Action Coalition, I designed a flexible identity system built around PP Neue Montreal and a muted core palette, with a defined flex space for youth and volunteer communications.

processIntro: The goal was to design a core identity for Hunger Action Coalition that felt credible and consistent, while building in a flexible space for youth and volunteer outreach.

gallery.caption: Logo sketches and notes, final main logo in the top right. In this case I create a logo suite with a set or wordmarks that can be used instead of the logo. The main icon of three wheat symbolizes the focus on hunger, and community.
Sketches and ideation for the main site.
Style tiles showcasing a more core visual for the main site, and a more vibrant, bold visual language for the volunteer pages.
Mobile screens used to show the contrast between the two languages at work.
